reasoning: The transcription details the process of making a pea pod soup. The steps are extracted based on the sequence of actions described by Jacques Pepin, starting with the preparation of pea pods and ending with the garnishing of the soup.
dish_description: The dish is a pea pod soup made from the flesh of pea pods, potatoes, onions, and seasoned with chicken bouillon. It is finished with cream and optionally garnished with char-siu for color.

cooking_steps.description: Break open pea pods to use the sweet flesh inside for the soup.
Strain the pea pod flesh with a food mill to remove the fibrous parts.
In a pot, add 4 cups of water or chicken stock and 2 teaspoons of chicken bouillon.
Add a pound of potatoes and a pound of peas to the pot.
Include about 3/4 to 1 cup of onions into the pot.
Season with salt to taste, depending on the saltiness of your stock.
Bring the mixture to a strong boil, then cover, lower the heat, and cook for 30 minutes.
After cooking, strain the soup to remove all the fibers, rinse with some stock, and then return the liquid to the pot.
Finish the soup by stirring in about a third of a cup of cream.
Serve the soup with an optional garnish of char-siu for color.
